summary: Create a marketing/landing homepage for Bro Bro Foods with defined sections and cohesive theme, plus a working Order Now flow that collects plate selection and customer delivery details and initiates ordering via WhatsApp to the business number with an auto-filled message.
architectural_notes: Ordering will be initiated via WhatsApp deep link to +91 97973 82618 with a prefilled message containing order selections and captured customer details.
WhatsApp ordering deep link should target the business number provided by user: 7973782618 (normalize to E.164 +91 79737 82618 if required by the WhatsApp URL scheme).
Payment UX decision: show Paytm QR code after order is placed (on confirmation screen), not before or always-visible.
known_issues: Ordering is not working: user cannot select Half/Full plate and cannot place orders.
Deployment unsuccessful (deployment error encountered; details not provided in chat).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Paytm QR code image (paytm-qr.dim_900x900.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page marketing homepage for the brand “Bro Bro Foods” with the following sections in this order: Hero, About, Menu, How to Order, Why Choose Us, Pricing Highlight, Order Now (CTA), Contact Us, Footer. Each section must be navigable via in-page anchors (e.g., header nav links that scroll to sections).

Implement the Hero section content with English-only user-facing text: Heading “Bro Bro Foods”; subheading “Fresh Veg Momos, Fast Delivery”; tagline “Half Plate ₹50 | Full Plate ₹80”; primary button “Order Now”; secondary button “Download App”. The “Order Now” button must scroll to the Order Now (CTA) section. The “Download App” button must open a small modal or inline message stating “App coming soon” (no external links unless configured later).
Implement the About Us section with heading “About Bro Bro Foods” and the provided paragraph content, using English-only text and removing emoji from display text.

Implement the Menu section with heading “Our Menu” and two menu cards: (1) “Veg Momos – Half Plate”, quantity “12 Pieces”, price “₹50”, description “12 fresh veg momos served hot with spicy red chutney.” (2) “Veg Momos – Full Plate”, quantity “24 Pieces”, price “₹80”, description “24 fresh veg momos with special spicy chutney. Best Seller”.

Implement the How It Works section with heading “How to Order” and a numbered step list using English-only text: “Open Bro Bro Foods App or Website”, “Select Veg Momos”, “Choose Half or Full Plate”, “Place Order & Relax”, “Fresh momos delivered hot and fast”.

Implement the Why Choose Us section with heading “Why Bro Bro Foods?” and five bullet points in English-only text: “Freshly prepared Veg Momos”, “Affordable prices”, “Fast local delivery”, “Hygienic cooking”, “Trusted local brand”.

Implement the Pricing Highlight section with heading “Simple & Honest Pricing” and English-only text: “No hidden charges.” “Pay only for what you eat.” followed by a price list: “Half Plate – ₹50”, “Full Plate – ₹80”, “Delivery Charge – ₹20”, “Free Delivery above ₹199”.

Implement the Order Now (CTA) section with heading “Hungry? Order Now!”, supporting text “Fresh Veg Momos are just one click away.” and two buttons: “Order on App” and “Order on Website”. Both buttons should open a modal or inline message stating “Ordering links coming soon” (until URLs are provided).
Implement the Contact Us section with heading “Contact Bro Bro Foods” and English-only details displayed as plain text: “Location: Your Local Area”, “Phone: XXXXXXXXXX”, “Timing: 5:00 PM – 11:00 PM”.
Implement the Footer with English-only text: “© Bro Bro Foods” and “Local Taste • Honest Price” plus an extra line “More tasty items coming soon…”.

Add an optional promotional popup that can be dismissed and does not reappear during the same browser session. Popup English-only text must be: Title “Fresh Veg Momos”, line “Starting at ₹50”, and a button “Order Now” that scrolls to the Order Now (CTA) section. The popup should appear once after a short delay (e.g., ~2 seconds) on first visit.

Apply a cohesive visual theme suitable for a street-food brand: warm appetizing palette (avoid blue/purple), bold headline typography, high-contrast CTA buttons, and consistent spacing/section dividers. The theme must be used consistently across all sections.

Add the generated static images (listed in Image Requirements) under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them on the homepage: a small brand mark in the header/hero area and a hero background/illustration in the Hero section. Images must be loaded as static assets (no backend image serving).

Replace the non-functional ordering experience in the "Order Now" section with a working in-page order form that lets users (a) select exactly one plate type (Half Plate or Full Plate) and (b) submit/place an order successfully.

Wire the frontend order form to the backend order-creation method using the existing actor infrastructure so that submitting the form actually calls the canister and uses the response to confirm the order.

Update the in-page Order Now form UI to collect customer delivery details in addition to plate selection: add input fields for "Mobile Number" and "Delivery Address" with English-only labels, placeholders, and validation feedback.

Persist the captured customer delivery details with the order by extending the backend order model and the order creation call: update the Motoko canister `createOrder` method to accept mobile number and delivery address, store them in the returned `Order`, and update the frontend `useCreateOrder` hook + OrderForm submission payload accordingly.

Update the Order Now flow so that after an order is successfully created, the app opens WhatsApp chat to the business number 7973782618 with an auto-filled, URL-encoded message that includes the order ID, selected plate type name, and price.
Update the Contact section to display the business contact phone/WhatsApp number as 7973782618 (English-only text).

Update the Order Now form to let customers choose the number of plates (quantity) in addition to selecting exactly one plate type (Half Plate or Full Plate), and compute/display the total amount as (unit price × quantity) in the form UI using English-only labels.

Add and enforce a minimum delivery order rule in the Order Now form, with clear English-only messaging. The rule must be implemented as a single easy-to-change constant (e.g., MIN_PLATES_FOR_DELIVERY or MIN_TOTAL_FOR_DELIVERY) and the form must prevent order submission when the rule is not met.

Wire the updated Order Now form quantity + total amount flow end-to-end: update the frontend mutation (`useCreateOrder`), types, and submission payload to pass quantity to the backend, and update the WhatsApp message to include quantity and total amount in English.
After an order is successfully placed, show a post-order confirmation UI (modal/confirmation screen) that includes a Paytm QR code for payment (Option A: show QR code after order is placed).

In the post-order confirmation UI, display a clear bill breakdown that includes (1) items total (from the created order total amount), (2) delivery charge (₹20), and (3) grand total (items total + delivery charge).

Ensure the Paytm QR + bill breakdown appears in the same post-order confirmation modal/screen regardless of whether WhatsApp auto-open succeeds or a WhatsApp fallback link is shown due to popup blocking.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build Bro Bro Foods homepage/landing page with provided content sections and CTAs (Order Now, Download App, Order on App/Website).
Add optional website promotional popup/offer script with provided text (Fresh Veg Momos starting @ ₹50, Order Now).
Fix ordering UX so users can select Half/Full plate and successfully place an order (current order flow not working).
Implement backend order creation in the single Motoko actor so the frontend can persist a placed order (at minimum: plate type, price, created timestamp, and a unique order id).
Add customer details form to the Order Now flow to collect delivery address and customer mobile number (in addition to plate selection) for submitting the order.
Update Order Now action to open WhatsApp to the provided number with an auto-filled message including the selected plate type (and customer details once captured).
Auto-generate and display an order number/Order ID automatically for each placed order.
Show order quantity (number of plates) and compute/display total amount in the order flow/WhatsApp order details.
Add and enforce a minimum order requirement for delivery (e.g., minimum number of plates or minimum total amount), with clear user-facing messaging.

Extend the backend order model and order creation API to persist order quantity and total amount. Update `createOrder` in `backend/main.mo` to accept a `quantity` parameter, compute `totalAmount` (unit price × quantity), store both on the `Order`, and return them to the frontend.
Add Paytm QR code payment step: display the provided Paytm QR code on the post-order confirmation screen (after the order is placed) and include total bill (items + delivery charge).
